title: K-12 Augmented Reality-Based Interior Design Master Class: Strengthening Social Space Design Competency

context.prior_knowledge: Basic concepts of interior design, foundational understanding of technical drawings, and experience with social space utilization cases
context.additional_context: Establishment of a real-time collaborative and project-based assessment environment using digital devices. Includes community space design tasks to foster learners' civic consciousness.

learning_goals: Learners enhance their ability to design spaces considering social interactions by placing 3D furniture models using AR applications.
Learners accurately identify over 10 indoor design symbols and spatial usage norms and apply them to real-life spaces.
Learners evaluate their ability to make culturally contextualized spatial planning decisions by comparing and analyzing various design layouts in real time.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
